pros: I absolutely love working here. The staff and crew that I worked with were like family we got along very well and worked hard.
cons: The pay kind of sucked and at the time there wasn’t any room for advancing.

pros: Close to home, friendly coworkers, always kept clean. Go out of way. To keep student body successful

Supportive Leadership. 
8-week Terms. 
Faculty Development Opportunities.

review_title: Amazing atmosphere.  Just needs more time to grow!
pros: I loved working for UAV.  Very friendly faculty and staff overall.  Ive made amazing friends the Johnsons are by far the best bosses I've probably ever had.  They are an amazing couple and I fully support their vision and what they are doing for the Antelope Valley.
cons:
-Pay is very low compared to industry standard
-lack pf benefits (no paid vacations, very high insurance plans, bare minimum sick leave)
-Main campus on Sierra Highway (multiple strange visitors on a weekly basis)

pros: Absolutely no pros except that I made a few good friends.
cons: Lack of professionalism, fraternization between staff and students, students with questionable criminal background, managers are not qualified and have fake degrees. One of them has an associate in interior decorating. CEO assistant is rude and lacks actual people and work skills. There are some good people there that keep UAV running but they are leaving by the droves. High turnover rates. High tuition with no advance technology available to staff and students. Campus is also falling apart. It's a lawsuit waiting to happen. Absolutely no values or integrity.

pros: You have excellent co workers who are hard working and educated.
Great co-workers. Relaxed work environment.  Plenty of projects to work on.
cons: Constant bottleneck effect of projects stalling due to approval process.
